record.field: # Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = contract.wage * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = employee.seniority_pay if employee.seniority_pay else 0.0

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = contract.wage * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = categories.BASIC + categories.ALW + 0.75 * employee.pension_allowance

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = categories.GROSS * 0.04

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = (categories.GROSS - categories.CNSS) * 0.1

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' base = categories.GROSS - categories.CNSS - categories.PROFEXP if base > 10000000/12: result = 0.15 * 10000000/12 + 0.05 * (base-10000000/12) else: result = base * 0.15

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = min(36000, (6000)*employee.nbr_dependents)

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = contract.pension_annuities

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = employee.mortgage_interests

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = contract.life_insurance

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = 1000 * ((categories.GROSS - categories.CNSS - categories.PROFEXP - categories.TAXAL - categories.DEPENDENTS - categories.PENSION)//1000)

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' if categories.NTS <= 75000: result = 250 else: result = 125

# Available variables: #--------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days. # inputs: object containing the computed inputs. # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' nts = categories.NTS result = 0 if nts > 1250000: result += 0.35 * (nts - 1250000) nts = 1250000 if nts > 10000000/12: result += 0.3 * (nts - 10000000/12) nts = 10000000/12 if nts > 500000: result += 0.25 * (nts - 500000) nts = 500000 if nts > 4000000/12: result += 0.15 * (nts - 4000000/12) nts = 4000000/12 if nts > 75000: result += 0.07 * (nts - 75000)

# Available variables: #---------------------- # payslip: object containing the payslips # employee: hr.employee object # contract: hr.contract object # rules: object containing the rules code (previously computed) # categories: object containing the computed salary rule categories (sum of amount of all rules belonging to that category). # worked_days: object containing the computed worked days # inputs: object containing the computed inputs # Note: returned value have to be set in the variable 'result' result = rules.NET > categories.NET * 0.10
